question: who abandoned traditional harmony and created the twelve-tone system for composition
vanilla_rag_result: The twelve-tone system for composition was created by Arnold Schoenberg, who abandoned traditional harmony in favor of this new method. Although Josef Matthias Hauer published his "law of the twelve tones" in 1919, it was Schoenberg who developed the more widely known version of the twelve-tone technique in the 1920s.
